alert.note: Alert for Stokes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:48AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stokes and southeastern Patrick Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1148 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hanging Rock State Park, or near Francisco, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stuart... Danbury... Francisco... Sandy Ridge... Critz... Collinstown... and Ayersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
